metadata.title: CVE-2020-6800 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 72 and Firefox ESR 68.4. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. In general, theseflaws cannot be exploited through email in the Thunderbird product becausescripting is disabled when reading mail, but are potentially risks inbrowser or browser-like contexts. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <68.5, Firefox < 73, and Firefox < ESR68.5.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
